meanings.definition: Move or cause to move downwards.
meanings.sent1: She decided to lower the volume of the music.
meanings.sent2: The sun will lower in the sky as evening approaches.
meanings.sent3: The magician lowered the rabbit into the hat, but it never came out!
meanings.sent4: His spirits began to lower like a sinking ship in stormy seas.
meanings.sent5: The elevator started to lower slowly, making everyone nervous.

meanings.definition: Denoting the second of two things mentioned.
meanings.sent1: She preferred the lower bunk in the bunk bed.
meanings.sent2: The lower shelf is where we keep the heavier books.
meanings.sent3: The lower number on the scale made her jump for joy.
meanings.sent4: His lower score in the game motivated him to practice more.
meanings.sent5: The lower step on the staircase creaked under his weight.

meanings.definition: Denoting the part of a country that is farther from the capital.
meanings.sent1: The lower regions of the country were less populated.
meanings.sent2: The lower provinces had their own unique traditions.
meanings.sent3: Living in the lower area meant a longer commute to work.
meanings.sent4: The lower territories were known for their scenic beauty.
meanings.sent5: The lower districts were often overlooked by tourists.
